thread.title: Republican senator opposes making temporary tax cuts permanent

title: Republican senator opposes making temporary tax cuts permanent
text:
April 18, 2018 / 1:52 PM / Updated 6 hours ago Republican senator opposes making temporary tax cuts permanent Reuters Staff 1   A senior U.S. Republican senator said on Wednesday he would strongly oppose any plan to make permanent the temporary individual tax cuts that are included in a tax overhaul recently passed by Congress. Senator Bob Corker (R-TN) speaks to reporters as he arrives for the weekly Senate Republican policy luncheon   April 17, 2018. REUTERS/Joshua Roberts 
“It’s transparently political and bad for our nation,” Senator Bob Corker told reporters at a breakfast sponsored by the Christian Science Monitor. He called the idea “grotesque.” 
Republican leaders in the U.S. Congress are moving forward with a plan to vote, before the 2018 midterm elections, on a bill to make permanent the temporary individual tax cuts in their recent tax overhaul. 
It is not yet clear, however, if the plan would pick up support from Democrats, whose votes would be needed to pass legislation in the Senate. Corker’s comments indicated that the plan would also face resistance from some Republicans. Reporting by Patricia Zengerle; Editing by Bernadette Baum
